item.title: 股市投资者被特朗普瞄准国防和住房领域而陷入震荡
item.description: 特朗普总统周三在社交媒体平台发布一系列煽动性帖文，宣布针对住房和国防产业的可能改变游戏规则的新政策，引发股市剧烈震荡。【原文：With a series of incendiary posts on his social-media platform, President Donald Trump shook up the stock market on Wednesday by announcing potentially game-changing new policies targeting the housing and defense industries.】

item.title: 中国OpenAI竞争对手智普科技在香港上市，完成5.58亿美元IPO融资
item.description: 知识图谱科技有限公司将于周四在香港上市交易，此前该公司完成5.58亿美元首次公开募股，成为首家登陆香港主板的中国大型生成式人工智能初创企业。【原文：Knowledge Atlas Technology JSC Ltd. will start trading in Hong Kong on Thursday after a $558 million initial public offering, becoming the first major Chinese generative-AI startup to list.】

item.title: 泰国下月大选临近 主要竞争者浮出水面
item.description: 泰国正筹备于2月8日举行大选，此次选举可能迎来三年内的第四位总理。这场提前选举预计将产生联合政府，加剧政治持续动荡的风险。【原文：Thailand is gearing up for a general election Feb. 8, which could usher in the fourth prime minister in three years. The snap vote is expected to produce a coalition government, heightening the risk of continued political instability.】

item.title: 特朗普阻止企业购房的举措令华尔街措手不及
item.description: 企业房东作为美国住房恶棍的时代本应已经结束。【原文：The time of the corporate landlord as America’s housing villain was supposed to be over.】

item.title: 三星创纪录利润：人工智能推动内存市场强劲增长
item.description: 三星电子的利润飙升208%，超出预期，这得益于全球对人工智能服务器的需求激增，从而大幅推高了内存芯片价格。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co.’s profit jumped a better-than-projected 208%, driven by surging global demand for AI servers that sharply lifted memory chip prices.】

item.title: 美联储鲍曼提出银行评级与监管门槛调整方案
item.description: 美联储负责监管事务的副主席米歇尔·鲍曼表示，该机构正在重新审视其发布某些银行评级的方式，延续了特朗普时期更广泛的努力，旨在将监管重点重新聚焦于对贷款机构构成重大风险的问题。【原文：Federal Reserve Vice Chair for Supervision Michelle Bowman said the agency is revisiting how it issues certain bank ratings, continuing a broader Trump-era effort to refocus supervision on issues posing a significant risk to lenders.】

item.title: 安杜瑞尔创始人表示不反对国防薪酬上限
item.description: 安杜里尔工业公司创始人帕尔默·卢基表示，他不反对特朗普总统提出的对国防公司实施监管的建议，包括限制薪酬的措施。【原文：Anduril Industries Inc. founder Palmer Luckey said he didn’t oppose regulations on defense companies proposed by President Donald Trump, including limits on compensation.】

item.title: 雪佛龙考虑重启委内瑞拉原油采购，埃利奥特收购案尚待定夺
item.description: 由委内瑞拉间接持股的美国炼油商雪佛龙石油公司，可能成为特朗普总统计划将该国数百万桶石油运往美国的主要受益者之一。【原文：Citgo Petroleum Corp., the US refiner indirectly owned by Venezuela, may emerge as one of the biggest beneficiaries of President Donald Trump’s plan to bring millions of barrels of the country’s oil to the US.】

item.title: 亚洲股市料将下跌，2026年涨势动能减弱：市场综述
item.description: 亚洲股市周四开盘料将走低，此前全球股市和美国国债收益率下跌，交易员们正在消化喜忧参半的美国经济数据以及快速变化的地缘政治背景。【原文：Asian equities look set to open lower Thursday after global shares and Treasury yields fell as traders digested mixed US economic data and a quickly shifting geopolitical backdrop.】

item.title: 日资药企掀收购浪潮，久光制药交易后
item.description: 久光制药公司斥资4570亿日元（约合29亿美元）实施私有化计划，被视为日本制药企业逃离公开市场的典型案例，分析师预计将有更多企业效仿。【原文：Hisamitsu Pharmaceutical Co.’s ¥457 billion ($2.9 billion) plan to go private is being seen as a prime example of a flight from public markets among Japan’s drugmakers, with analysts expecting more to follow.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚称油价暴跌令第四季度业绩缩水10亿美元
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司表示，油价下跌导致第四季度业绩减少8亿至12亿美元，这是大型石油公司面临艰难财报季的早期迹象之一。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. said lower oil prices reduced fourth-quarter results by $800 million to $1.2 billion, one of the first signs that Big Oil is facing a tough earnings season.】

item.title: 新加坡人工智能训练营内部实录：3.5万银行职员接受再培训
item.description: Kelvin Chiang深知，其团队开发的五款智能代理AI模型能在十分钟内完成以往私人银行家耗费整日的工作。凭借这一成果，他前往新加坡银行监管机构展示，证明这些安全措施足以有效管控风险。【原文：Kelvin Chiang knew the five agentic AI models built by his team could in ten minutes do what used to take a private banker an entire day. With that in place, he went to show Singapore’s banking regulator the safeguards would sufficiently control the risks.】

item.title: 巴西审计法院撤回撤销破产清算的威胁
item.description: 巴西审计法院院长表示，只有最高法院才能推翻央行清算陷入困境的Banco Master SA银行的决定，这实际上撤回了此前推翻货币当局裁决的威胁。【原文：The head of Brazil’s Audit Court said that only the Supreme Court can reverse a central bank decision to liquidate troubled Banco Master SA, effectively backing away from a previous threat to overturn the monetary authority’s ruling.】

item.title: 全球最糟糕的债券市场面临又一次重大供应冲击
item.description: 日本政府债券市场将迎来又一个艰难之年，投资者正面临十多年来最大的净增供应量。【原文：Japan’s government bond market is set for another tough year as investors contend with the largest net increase in supply in well over a decade.】

item.title: 美国蓝筹债券销售额达880亿美元，创2020年以来最繁忙的一周
item.description: 投资级企业正掀起自疫情时期繁荣以来最大规模的美国借贷热潮。【原文：Investment-grade firms are on their biggest US borrowing spree since the pandemic-era boom.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行败诉，2100万美元苏丹判决维持原判
item.description: 纽约一名法官驳回了法国巴黎银行撤销一项2075万美元判决的请求。该判决认定该银行为在苏丹实施大规模侵犯人权行为的政权提供资金支持。【原文：A New York judge denied BNP Paribas SA’s request to throw out a $20.75 million verdict against the bank for funding a regime that committed widespread human rights abuses in Sudan.】

item.title: 更低运费推动美国主要实物原油等级价格上涨
item.description: 油轮运费的下降正改善美国原油的出口前景，尤其是轻质低硫原油的价格正因此获得提振。【原文：Falling tanker rates are improving the export outlook for US crude, and prices for light sweet barrels, in particular, are getting a lift.】

item.title: 据称Olaplex吸引德国汉高公司收购要约
item.description: 知情人士透露，汉高集团已对奥拉普莱克斯控股公司提出收购要约。此前这家洗发水制造商自首次公开募股以来市值蒸发逾90%。受此消息影响，该公司股价上涨逾36%。【原文：Henkel AG has submitted a takeover offer for Olaplex Holdings Inc, according to people with knowledge of the matter, after the shampoo maker lost over 90% of its value since its initial public offering. The stock rose more than 36%.】

item.title: 美国干预能否让委内瑞拉债券在多年违约后重获生机？
item.description: 随着1月3日美国特种部队逮捕委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯·马杜罗，该国债券重新进入投资者视野，市场正日益将长期延迟的债务重组可能性纳入定价考量。【原文：Venezuela’s bonds are back on investors’ radar following the seizure of President Nicolas Maduro by US special forces on Jan. 3, with markets increasingly pricing in the possibility of a long-delayed debt restructuring.】

item.title: 2026年开局全球债券销售额创纪录达2300亿美元
item.description: 全球债券销售即将迎来史上最繁忙的开年，各类借款人正抓住投资者对风险的无止境渴求。【原文：Global bond sales are poised to mark the busiest ever start to a year as borrowers of every stripe seize on investors’ insatiable appetite for risk.】

item.title: Zadeh Kicks创始人因运动鞋欺诈案被判70个月监禁
item.description: 球鞋转售平台Zadeh Kicks的创始人因参与欺诈阴谋被判处近六年监禁，该阴谋导致该在线平台臭名昭著地崩盘，造成客户和金融机构损失8000万美元。【原文：The founder of sneaker reseller Zadeh Kicks was sentenced to almost six years in prison for a fraud conspiracy that led to the infamous collapse of the online platform and $80 million in losses for customers and financial institutions.】

item.title: OpenAI推出ChatGPT健康版，可解读检测结果与饮食建议
item.description: OpenAI在ChatGPT中推出新功能，用户可借此分析医疗检测结果、准备就诊事宜，并获取饮食及锻炼计划指导——这标志着该公司迄今为止在医疗保健领域最重大的举措。【原文：OpenAI is introducing a new feature in ChatGPT that will allow users to analyze medical test results, prepare for doctors appointments and seek guidance on diets and workout routines — marking the company’s biggest push yet into the health care sector.】

item.title: 银行经济学家呼吁税制改革以重振加拿大经济
item.description: 加拿大各大银行的经济学家呼吁总理马克·卡尼推行税制改革，认为其最新预算投资对提升竞争力收效甚微。【原文：Economists at Canada’s biggest banks are calling on Prime Minister Mark Carney to reform taxes, arguing his latest budget investments won’t meaningfully move the needle on competitiveness.】

item.title: 德国当局调查另一起电网攻击事件
item.description: 德国检察官正在调查一起针对杜塞尔多夫附近变电站的未遂袭击事件。就在几天前，柏林曾因类似事件引发大面积停电。【原文：German prosecutors are investigating a failed attack on a substation near Düsseldorf, in the west of the country, days after a similar incident triggered a power blackout in Berlin.】

item.title: 黑石、住宅建筑商股价因特朗普住房言论暴跌
item.description: 在特朗普总统表示将采取行动禁止机构投资者购买独栋住宅后，黑石集团及其他房地产相关公司的股价应声下跌。【原文：Shares of Blackstone Inc. and other housing-related companies tumbled after President Donald Trump said he would move to ban institutional investors from buying single-family homes.】

item.title: 戴比尔斯押注印度富豪阶层以提振天然钻石需求
item.description: 戴比尔斯押注印度日益壮大的富裕阶层将推动天然钻石需求增长，尽管全球市场仍面临挑战，且悬而未决的美印贸易协议正扰乱供应链。【原文：De Beers is betting on India’s surging affluent class to fuel growth in natural diamond demand, even as the global market remains challenging and a pending US-India trade deal disrupts supply chains.】

item.title: 赞比亚放弃将国际货币基金组织信贷安排延长一年的计划
item.description: 华盛顿国际货币基金组织周三表示，赞比亚已决定不寻求延长其将于本月到期的国际货币基金组织计划，该计划原定延长一年。这一转变将令投资者感到意外。【原文：Zambia has decided against pursuing a one-year extension of its International Monetary Fund program that’s set to expire this month, the Washington-based lender said on Wednesday, an about turn that will surprise investors.】

item.title: 《华尔街日报》称Anthropic以3500亿美元估值融资100亿美元
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》报道，开发聊天机器人Claude的人工智能初创公司Anthropic计划进行新一轮融资，拟筹集100亿美元资金，融资前公司估值将达3500亿美元。【原文：Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup behind the chatbot Claude, is planning to raise $10 billion in a funding round that would value the company at $350 billion before the new investment, the Wall Street Journal reported.】

item.title: 雀巢扩大召回部分婴儿配方奶粉至中国和巴西
item.description: 雀巢公司因潜在污染风险，将部分婴儿配方奶粉产品的召回范围从欧洲扩大至中国和巴西。【原文：Nestlé SA widened a recall of some baby formula products beyond Europe to China and Brazil over potential contamination concerns.】

item.title: 美洲原住民团体支持与卡尔希、罗宾汉的法律争斗
item.description: 随着科技公司与部落间的紧张关系不断升级，多家美洲原住民团体已提交法律文件，支持威斯康星州某部落针对预测交易平台运营商Kalshi公司及经纪商Robinhood Markets公司的诉讼。【原文：A slate of Native American groups have filed a legal brief in support of a Wisconsin tribe’s case against prediction marketplace operator Kalshi Inc. and brokerage Robinhood Markets Inc. as tension between the technology companies and tribes escalates.】
